SENT.plain: Eleven patients with primary thunderclap headache (TCH) were treated with oral nimodipine 30 to 60 mg every 4 hours or IV nimodipine 0.5 to 2 mg/h if the oral regimen failed or images showed cerebral vasospasm
With oral nimodipine, headache did not recur in the nine patients without vasospasm
IV nimodipine was given in two patients with vasospasm, including one who developed ischemic stroke
Nimodipine may be effective for TCH
